definitions: the action or process of measuring the depth of the sea or other body of water.
shortDefinitions: action of measuring depth of body of water

definitions: the determination of any physical property at a depth in the sea or at a height in the atmosphere.
shortDefinitions: determination of any physical property at depth in sea or at height in atmosphere

definitions: the area of sea close to the shore which is shallow enough for the bottom to be reached by means of a sounding line.
shortDefinitions: area of sea close to shore which is shallow enough for bottom

definitions: information or evidence ascertained as a preliminary step before deciding on a course of action

examples.text: he's been taking soundings about the possibility of moving his offices

shortDefinitions: information or evidence ascertained as preliminary step before taking action

definitions: giving forth sound, especially loud or resonant sound

examples.text: he went in with a sounding plunge

definitions: having an imposing sound but little substance

examples.text: the orator has been apt to deal in sounding commonplaces

shortDefinitions: having imposing sound but little substance
